image.altText: Jeremy Rockliff in Parliament, in Hobart on 19 August, 2025.

props.synopsis: Tasmanian politicians will receive a 22 per cent pay rise despite the government's attempts to block it, with premier Jeremy Rockliff saying he will personally be rejecting his $68,000 increase.

title.children: Tasmanian MPs to receive $30,000 pay rise after upper house tussle

image.altText: Dr Peter Renshaw sits in front of a microphone.

props.synopsis: A review has found three Tasmanian public servants did not act in good faith during the state's child abuse commission of inquiry and recommends clawing back up to $76,000 in legal fees.

title.children: Government seeks to claw back $56k legal bill from former LGH boss

image.altText: Weona Park Stud

props.synopsis: A Tasmanian horse breeder has been told to reduce the number of horses on her property and rehome them, after concerns were raised by members of the racing community.

title.children: Horse breeder feels 'harassed' after social media storm leads to inspection

image.altText: A map showing a red circle over a national park in Tasmania's west.

props.synopsis: Tasmania records a magnitude-4.1 earthquake in the state's south-west that was felt from Maydena to Hobart.

title.children: Magnitude-4.1 earthquake rattles Tasmania like a 'thunderclap'

image.altText: A woman wearing a red apron smiles in a kitchen with pale yellow walls and mugs on the bench in front of her.

image.altText: A young man with shoulder-length red hair and a young woman with braided blonde hair.

image.altText: A driver uses a mobile phone in black and white image.

image.altText: Woman with smallish, white, fluffy dog sitting on her lap as she reclines on the couch

props.synopsis: Veteran stockbroker Marcus Padley says he's "on guard" for a share market wipe-out. image.altText: A sign reads "Forensic Science Queensland".
